Html:
Hello,

i am using the "IEEE_Alphabetical" style and the German Word 2007 version, but the output of the tag in the text and in the index is only [BO].

In the stylesheet is written this:

<openbracket>[</openbracket>
<closebracket>]</closebracket>
<separator>,</separator>
<source type="Placeholder">
<format>%Tag%</format>
</source>
<source type="Book">
<format>{%BibOrder|"BO"%}</format>

Can anybody help me?
Word can't handle alphabetical numbered sorting by itself. See http://bibword.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=Styles_FAQ&referringTitle=Styles#Q4

Thanks a lot for the fast reply. But now i want to change the Numbers in [..] to  a tag-Name, like [Bid08] for Marc Bidmus ,..., .., .., 2008.

what is the code for it and how to insert it into the style sheet?

Change the

{%BibOrder|"BO"%}

into

{%Tag%}

For a list of all available variables, check the help.
